generated_text:
- road: The cobblestone surface extending from the foreground into the distance, with parked cars and a visible lane for vehicles, qualifies as a road.
- sidewalk: The elevated stone pavement along the building on the right, separated from the road by a curb, is designated for pedestrians and thus qualifies as a sidewalk.
- building: The structures on both sides of the street, with windows, doors, and architectural features, are clearly buildings.
- wall: The large stone wall on the right side of the image, which is part of a building but visually distinct as a standalone wall section, qualifies as a wall.
- person: A person in a light-colored coat is visible standing on the left side of the street, near the building.
- car: Several cars are parked along the left side of the street, including a black SUV and a black sedan.
- traffic sign: A small rectangular sign with text is mounted on the stone wall on the right side of the street.
